The jokes come at a regular pace, but no matter how funny, they never build to a climax.I recommend a two-drink minimum.

reviews.review_title: This movie made me have cabin fever
reviews.content: I am a huge horror movie buff, I love cheesiest to the most terrifying. This movie was just plain awful. I wanted to leave half way through it but my need to see it improve made me stay. It didn't. I won't even go into the multiple plot holes the movie had. Let's just say the movie explains nothing. The gore and gratuitous violence is no where near clever enough to pull off. The acting, with the exception of the lead was less then poor. I would wait until late night cable for this one folks, at least you won't waste a penny but maybe 90 minutes of your life.

I don't know why everyone said this was a horror movie. It's so over-the-top ridiculous it's obvioulsy a tongue-in-cheek (if you have cheeks, that is) comedy. For instance the gun is for niggers thing. The whole thing is a farce. Loved it. Beautiful cinematography too.. very well filmed. Only thing I didn't like was the "deputy" character.

reviews.review_title: One of the worse movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: If I had to choose a Top 10 of worst movies I've ever seen, Eli Roth's Cabin Fever would be a very close tie with the first three Faces Of Death movies as the #1 worst movie I've ever seen. I couldn't stand sitting through this piece of trash for more than 5 minutes without hating every single last character in this film. It starts off with a bunch of unlikable morons in a pointless setup to a very unfunny race joke that doesn't get resolved until the very end, said joke involved a redneck store owner implying that a rifle is meant for "n!ggers", when really the punch line is that this redneck is trying to speak jive without knowing how to phrase such language and the gun belongs to the African American customers and he meant to say "N!gga". That's the caliber of humor in this pile of garbage and it get worse and worse as the minutes go by, and the thing is the concept could have made for a decent horror film but ends up screwing itself over so much that you want to take an angle grinder to your temple to get out of it.

I was very surprised when I saw the rating for this movie. This is a horror-flick that is HORROR with capitals! I liked it very much, it's bloody, it's weird, it's sexy and most of all: it's scary. It has a good soundtrack. Okay, the story is crap, but what's new in horror?? And what does the young boy means?? I don't know and I don't bother to know. I've seen thousands of horror-movies in my (short) life (I'm 35 at the moment) and I think personally that this is new, never done before. Something else. I liked it, have I said that? When you don't like horror-movies; don't watch it then! Then it's a bunch of crap, but if you love horror-movies.... Then enjoy!

Ditto that comment about non-horror fans reviewing horror movies. If you want to play Ebert and Roeper, go watch "21 Grams". If you're watching a horror film, you're looking more for a thrill than for anything else. This is not one of the best horror films of recent years, there have actually been quite a few very good ones recently, but it's fun entertainment in the style of the comedy/horror films that you might have seen at a drive-in in the '80s. It's the kind of movie I wanted to hate: as I watched it, I couldn't help but be constantly reminded of better films (particularly "28 Days Later"), but it never loses its sense of fun. There's something really good about cheese that knows that it's cheese, and doesn't take itself too seriously. It's not all that scary, not hilariously funny, not really great at any one thing (except maybe shock- the gore gets pretty nasty)...but it's just good enough at a lot of things to make a pretty entertaining movie. I wouldn't rush out to see it, but it's by no means a waste of an evening.
There is nothing scary about this movie but disgust. Acting of characters is good but the plot and main idea is full of crap.

This film was terrible as a thriller/horror, however it served as the best comedy me and my friend had seen in a long time. We literally had to hold our laughter in at some scenes, they were just so out there and daft, when Dennis started doing karate, it was so random, and just hilarious.I lost the plot of the story midway as the silliness of a lot of it, just lost my interest. The acting was good, but the plot ruined their performance. Don't get me wrong, this maybe some peoples ''cup of tea'' and quite a few friends found the film ''entertaining'' and ''jumpy'', but most concluded like myself ''different''I would recommend you rent the film out, if your in for a bit of lighthearted horror - I promise you, you will laugh.

reviews.review_title: Dreadful - Why was this film unleashed on good people?!?
reviews.content: I really don't know where to begin. I had wanted to see this film for ages before I actually saw it as I am a horror film freak & am really into the contemporary teen slasher films, you know, Wrong Turn, Texas Chainsaw Massacre, etc, (as well as more traditional horror movies! Can't beat The Fog, The Haunting, The Wicker Man, & all those other amazing films!). So, my expectations were high....Words cannot describe how crap this film is, they really can't. The plot is terrible, atrocious acting, lacking in any kind of resolution or conclusion at the end, just plain b****cks. I remember sitting there watching it, thinking I was watching a film that was made purely as a joke. I couldn't believe that somebody actually thought it was a good idea & a good result. When it was over, I was expecting the film to suddenly start again, with a "proper" story, & that what I'd just seen would prove to have been one big nasty trick & I would soon be presented with the "real" thing. Realising it was indeed over, I thought "What the hell did I do to deserve that?" Please, I beg, do not waste your time or your money on this pile of dog turd. In fact, I do urge all people to see it just so they can grasp how bad it is!

One of the worst movies I've ever seen. There's no such thing as a movie that could scare me; but this movie just made me laugh half of the time. You got a so-called 'horror' movie here and it's making me feel a combination of laughter/boredom/changing the channel when the commercials come up.One of the worst movies I've ever seen. There's no such thing as a movie that could scare me; but this movie just made me laugh half of the time. You got a so-called 'horror' movie here and it's making me feel a combination of laughter/boredom/changing the channel when the commercials come up.

reviews.review_title: Bloody ,Scary Horror movie with some goofy comedy
reviews.content: This movie is fun and has some very memorable scenes. I feel it is realistic how the characters react to the disease. I love that song from "Last House on the Left" they used!!! If you like horror movies , you got to own this. Its comedy is cheesy and vulgar at times but it fits the whole homage to horror mixture in this movie. The scene in the bed made me walk out of the theater because it made me sick(finger in the sore)... no horror movie ever did that to my gut, i wanted to york..This movie played with my emotions the whole time. Eli Roth's cameo is hilarious. "Positive Bonfire" to all!! I recommend everyone watch Frailty, American Werewolf in London and Last House on the Left. B+

reviews.review_title: They don't make 'em like they used too. Or at least until now...
reviews.content: Cabin Fever makes a welcome return to those old 70's and 80's horror films with heaps of gore, violence and nudity. However Cabin Fever give a new spin on that. Instead of the boring masked killer stalking these kids holidaying in a log cabin, its an inescapable virus in the water supply... Director Eli Roth does great things with his cast. Who'd have thunk the perky breasted Foreign Exchange student from Not Another Teen Movie could actually act!?As for the strange ending involving an apparently racist shop keeper and three black teens walking towards his establishment, blame his friendship with David Lynch... Never before have i laughed so hard over a pointless joke in a film before. Things are looking up for horror. With this, Texas Chainsaw Massacre not sucking and 28 Days Later, we have been spoiled. Here's hoping that Wes Craven's Cursed doesn't suck...

It wasn't the bloodfest I had heard it was, though the KNB effects work was very well done, what there was of it. It's definitely a horror movie fan's movie - with audio and visual references to The Last House on the Left, Halloween, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre, and The Evil Dead to name but a few.The acting was good - my favourite character being Bert (played by James DeBello) who gets all the best lines.The DVD itself is a very nice affair, having a holographic cover, animated menus, 5 (yes, five!!!) audio commentaries, trailers, and a few other silly bits 'n' bobs. The 5.1 audio and 2:35 anamorphic transfer are excellent - Lion's Gate have excelled themselves with the quality of this one.The problem for me was that the film drags in places and is quite slow to build up, then towards the end when we want to see all the gory aftermath, it doesn't show us.*spoilers ahead*I wanted to see the head being shotgunned! I wanted to see her foot fall off! I wanted to see the dog eating her guts!*spoilers end* ...but sadly, we don't. Perhaps this is the way of the noughties horror film now?

Maybe the worst "horror" movie in history.  Dumb plot where nothing the characters do make any sense.  Let's see - someone comes to your cabin asking for help and you light him on fire.  That does not bode well for the "hero's" of the movie.  Even with the flesh eating virus running rampant, one couple still has time for a hop in the sack (by the way the best part of the movie though).  I found myself rooting for the virus since all the characters were so easy to dislike.  Not worth commenting anymore.  In the end everyone got what they deserved.  They even left open the chance of a sequel.  Where have all the good horror flicks gone???  This makes a lot of movies look like Gone with the Wind in comparison.

Cabin Fever reminded me of a time when I would wait for my parents to go to bed, sneak into the living room and watch the midnight show of the 70's and 80's B horror movies. Don't go to the theaters expecting to get as scared as you got when you watched The Exorcist for the first time. It's not scary, and it doesn't mean to be. In fact, the camera angles and the way the story is told makes me think of this as being almost an artistic film. It's definitely weird and unlike anything out there today. But the cast is excellent and you'll get some pretty good laughs. And if you still don't like it, at least you'll be able to say that you were open-minded enough to check it out!

reviews.review_title: Why do I like this movie?
reviews.content: Out of everybody I ask, I am the only one that likes this movie. So much in fact that I went out and bought it, and now I'm writing a review for it. Maybe I smoke too much pot! Anyway when it comes to making a great horror film, I think its imperative to have a great score,that is if you plan on having one at all. The music I believe was done beautifully, I really liked how they did the opening credits. Another thing that is interesting to me is the concept of an invisible killer. On the initial viewing I kept thinking at any moment a masked killer is going to start offing them one by one, but instead its a virus! Perhaps its a metaphor for something else. I agree with the other viewers there are scenes put in the movie that just don't make sense other than to add comic relief. But yet this would be a trademark for Eli Roth. By the way I think he is a fine director and has a passion for the horror genre and I will continue to watch future movies that he is involved with.
Unfortunately I went in thinking that this movie was going to be scary.. I was GROSSly misinformed.Some of this was grostesque, but other parts of the movie were actually really humorous.

reviews.review_title: Special in it's time, but possibly mundane now
reviews.content: Cabin Fever, when it came out, was a pretty original and surprisingly gory movie. I highly suggest you to watch this just because it is one of the first types of movies like this. The idea apart from the serial killer and exorcism movies was a whole new take. I believe that they did a really good job on everything, even though in 2002 the sfx might've not been as good. The acting was also appropriate and doesn't distract from the story. It's a GOOD movies, don't get me wrong, but because I've watched all the other Cabin Fever movies and all those zombie apocalypse movies, when I watched this, there was nothing new to me.So to people who have never watched movies along this storyline or genre, then I highly recommend your watch this movie and all the other original, classic horror films. These are the most worth watching.But to people who have already watched multiple newer horror movies about similar things, then don't expect too much nor anything different. It's a good movie, and it wasted my time in a good way. But there is nothing new nor crazy.

reviews.review_title: Biggest piece of crap ever made...
reviews.content: I don't have a whole lot to say other than this movie sucked.  It was terribly disjointed and poorly paced.  The acting wasn't great (I realize this IS a horror film), but that alone couldn't explain how bad this movie was.  I tried to fall asleep but couldn't, for some reason my eyes remained firmly fixed to the screen, kinda like when you pass a car accident and have to look out your window to see what happened.  Bottom line is, if you're 12 and have nothing better to do with your time than go for it...otherwise don't waste the 2 hours of your life... My Rating===> 0 out of 10

reviews.review_title: Do Yourself a Favor and Watch it.
reviews.content: If you dub yourself a "horror fan" then you have to see this one.Granted the Director's Cut makes things run smoother than the Theatrical Cut, the film is still solid. From the characters to the plot, everything works. Joey Kern as Jeff kills it. Giuseppe Andrews as Deputy Winston? Kills it. James DeBello as Burt is great as well, acting in a similar way to his role in "Detroit Rock City". Rider Strong as Paul is probably the weakest out of the actors for me but I can still get behind his performance. Cerina Vincent as Marcy is great and sexy. Jordan Ladd as Karen is the only other weak point I can see. Even the rednecks from the store work.Everything is how it should be and it's hard for me to try and see anything wrong with it. I just wish it were longer.The score is amazing and I'm not sure if anyone else noticed where some of them originated from. "Last House on the Left", anyone? Yes, some of the scores are from that 1972 film directed by Wes Craven. Those particular scores are by David A. Hess who stars in "Last House on the Left". It fits perfectly and just adds to the greatness and eeriness of this film. The other sounds and scores throughout the film are great, creepy and just make the movie flow so well.The vibe, the shots and the scenery in this film are excellent. Cabin Fever is certainly better than a lot of the people on here have made it out to be. Eli Roth definitely knew what he was doing when he set out to make this film and it was effectively shown. Do yourself a favor and watch it and appreciate it for what it is.

Wow, was this movie a let down for me.  I really was stunned when the credits started rolling, and all I could think about was the $17 I had just spent for the "privilege" of watching this film (for myself + 1).
Talk about a movie that doesn't go anywhere.  It just bounces around here and there, with no real direction, particularly in the latter half of the movie.  It seems like some scenes were just randomly drawn out of a hat and stuck in there.  It was not scary, nor was it funny.  It was gory, I will give it that, but so what?  A few buckets of blood does not a movie make. And what was the deal with that kid on the bench?  Pancakes and karate kicks?  Why?Why all the hype? I don't know.  Bad acting, bad story, bad ending.  The only redeeming part was looking at Cerina Vincent, and I couldn't even do that anymore after that bathtub scene *shudder*.Final score 1.5/10Don't waste your money, unless you like to watch movies that belong on the USA network at 3 in the morning.

reviews.review_title: We are all going to die!
reviews.content:
What do you get if you ad just a dose of Outbreaks disease, a big dose of youngsters going to a cabin to be `unmoral' like in Evil Dead, and one dose of various ingredients from other movies from similar genres?Well, you get Cabin Fever!This movie probably lacks every fresh thought, and every original idea in the world. But strangely enough it works...kind of. The story is set when a group of young fresh eager to die bunch of kids arrives to this cabin, where sex drugs and alcohol is just waiting to justify their horrible and painful death. Sounds familiar? Yes, but it is great fun, and they all get what they deserve. Or do they?
The moral in movies like this is always the same. If you don't follow the social rules, you will die die die! And society will fall fall fall. I think it's unfair to send out messages like this in the time we live in now, cause you will not die horribly if go out with you friends and have a good time. I would rather see a movie where a group of high society leaders, and stoke holders, fire 1000s of people, exploiting minorities and hard working people, die horrible instead! That would be interesting, that would be original. In the mean while I give Cabin Fever a 5 of 10. No masterpiece, but worth a look.

This is the most retarded movie I have ever seen!!!!! I can't believe anyone would watch this movie and actually think that it is anywhere near a good movie. The comedy is corny. The hole plot is just ridiculous. I wouldn't advise anyone to even think of paying money to see this movie. The beginning is ridiculous. The ending is ridiculous, and everything in between is ridiculous.To sum it up no one should think about watching this movie.

this was a really bad movie, i got it cos the cover looked good but my god what a disappointment. It started badly with some dude(the director I think) coming on introducing the movie to us, then we go into 5 kids going somewhere to do something that u never really care about, the characters themselves are not very interesting and u really don't care if they live or die .the girls are underused except when naked and there was to much blood, not enough plot, to many random bloody characters, and the ending had us just shaking our heads going ' are u kidding' save your money and time and have someone poke u hard with a sharp stick, it will have the same effect.

I have to admit that I went into this not knowing what to expect, but still not expecting much. I came out chuckling and felt like I didn't waste time watching this. This is like a mix of early 2000s frat humor and genuinely disturbing moments... but it's all fun. The kid at the store was absolutely hilarious and I watched the highly choreographed "PANCAKES" scene way more than I should've. I don't have any real criticisms. It's pretty well paced, you won't really get bored... it's a b film on a Hollywood horror budget and it does what it sets out to do. If you wanna expose someone to horror, this is a good place to start.

reviews.review_title: QT and PJ got it darn right!!
reviews.content: I heard before going to see this that Mr Tarantino loved this film, and so did Mr Jackson - if this is true, then those men have gone up even more in my respect> I loved this film - no, i really did; honestly - a group of seven friends went to a darkened theatre, and only one survived; the rest died in the agony of this film being, "terrible" did they say? "pointless", "toneless", "inconsistence" Jeez, i didnt know i was meant to be watching Lawrence of Arabia or something... Bigdeal if it was some of those things - things which i have to agree on i guess, but goddam i enjoyed this piece of trash - from its trashy acting, to its trashy plot, location and characters, and to its Jaws like music - i loved it. The poster is going on my wall, right damn now -NO PANCAKES!!

I remember when I saw a preview for Cabin Fever I thought it looked pretty good so I went to check this out the first day it came up. I thought it was a good horror movie with a cool cast and a fresh story. The only thing that let me down was the gore this movie is really made out to be some type of gore fest don't get me wrong there is some gore just don't like it is hyped up to be.Overall-Eli Roth has talent and I hope he makes more horror movies, Cabin Fever is a good horror flick to watch with some friends or whatever and its worth to buy on DVD.8/10

Eli Roth's Cabin Fever is a great horror movie. I've heard mixed reviews about this film, some people have said that it sucked badly and other people said they liked it. First off to the people who do not like this movie go don't you have anything better to do than to trash a movie you wish was yours. This is an old school horror movie updated with today's effects. The fact that the characters are in a cabin practically in the middle of nowhere makes it even better. The movie was made with 1.5 million dollars and it made back 21 million dollars. That's gotta say something. Cabin Fever is great movie with a good script by Eli Roth. The scene with the girl shaving her leg still freaks me out. And I don't even own the DVD! Roth's next film Hostel is going to be sick!

So, when I first heard of Cabin Fever, it had just come out on DVD, and my idiot neighbor described the plot to me. Being a nine-year old hypochondriac, I was absolutely terrified and refused to shower for weeks. The plot line of the movie continued to haunt me throughout the years. Fast forward to October '07. I was watching 30 Scarier Movie Moments on Bravo, when they proceeded to discuss the scene in which Marcy shaves the diseased skin off of her legs. I flipped out, turned off the TV, and called my boyfriend, at the time, sobbing. I'm not usually scared of things, but the reminder of my 9 year old trauma managed to do so. Being a slight sadist and a mass opportunist, he, of course, made me watch the movie when it came on Sci-Fi a week later.Upon seeing the movie, I laughed like a brain dead hyena, and felt undeniably stupid. I had, up until then, never seen anything so ridiculous. Cabin Fever is chock full of terrible, stolen horror movie gimmicks, useless characters, interchangeable comments, plot holes galore, and predictable, unneeded plot twists, giving you the feeling almost of a Family Guy spoof. It ranked up there with Friday the 13th in the unintelligent-to-the-point-of-vomit-horny teen-meets-machete category. The only moment in which the movie felt scary is the opening credits, where the sound of flies buzzing as the background color changes from parchment white to a bloody red, imitating the virus at work. The horror in that, and that scene alone, is infallible. Yet, the rest of the movie's ill-combined efforts to shock, disturb, humor, and arouse the audience fall flatter than the beloved pancakes of the redneck Karate Kid. For me, some of the king making scenes of Cabin Fever have to be when Paul and Marcy infect each other, almost deliberately, by sleeping together, accompanied by the ingenious line "You just want to grab the person next to you and ****, since you know you're gonna die anyway," and when an infected, well- shaved Marcy is torn apart afterward by a hungry dog for idiotically running away from the cabin two feet away towards a LOCKED shed to escape. And then, if that isn't enough, the dog tore her to shreds, leaving a foot intact. Last I checked, dogs were incapable of eating my skeletal system. Unrealistic, obvious, and just plain stupid.All in all, Cabin Fever is a worthless piece of garbage that is funny for all the wrong reasons. But if you're a masochist like me, you might enjoy the obvious deaths these stupid college kids endure every time you pop in the DVD. Seriously, it's funnier than Scary Movie could hope to achieve, folks. And yet they're actually trying to scare you.

This movie is like a pizza with anchovies scattered on it. You can take a couple of good bites but then you hit a bitter anchovy. (Or perhaps there are slightly more anchovies than good bites.) The basic plot has lots of problems. E.g. where does this disease come from? Why does the dumb dude just leave that sick guy in the woods? Does a cabin really get water straight from a stream, without any filtration? And the characters do dumb thing of course. And some things are just predictable (such as the ending with the one guy who survived but then met his fate as he was celebrating). But the weird humor throughout is just enough to save the movie from going straight into the campfire. The movie is really schizophrenic in this regard; at times it purports to be a real horror movie, and at others it makes a mockery of itself. E.g. early scene where the clerk asks the guy why he would steal a candy bar, and he answers "nougat"; that's funny. And the scene with the rifle in the store is funny; very long gap between set-up and delivery of that joke. You don't really want to see this movie; but if it's the only thing on at 2:00 a.m. and you can't sleep, then this will do.

This movie was awful.  What a low budget D movie. Can't believe all the hype about it, very misleading!  There is no plot and things do not make sense during the movie. It will leave you dumbfounded.  Where do they get the money to make movies like this.  No good actors or acting here!!

This is a great flick that is very loyal and pure to the genre. Eli Roths debut is a seeming success. Whereas it seems that some could view this as a trashy exploitation of pop culture others value its pure brilliance. Driven by its powerful cast the film mirrors slashers of old. Cabin Fever relies on the viewer for its main source of terror. It is within the viewers reaction where the films tension regins. The identification with set killer as well as protagonist sets Cabin Fever as a memorable part of slasher film history. The only complaint may be Roths constant gore at times takes away from the true terror. Regardless this film is definitely worth watching and must be taken for what it is.

Halfway through this movie I just didn't care who died or how they were going to die.  There was no suspense it was JUST A DISEASE, one that didn't shock me by the gore nor make me squirm at the situations.  I did however enjoy the humour in the movie intentional and otherwise.  Afterwards I felt as if Roth had kept us seated for 90 minutes just for the gun gag at the end which was set up at the beginning and everything in between was just a self-indulgent homage his favourite films.To say that this is up there with the best is very off the mark, it was neither scary nor thrilling.  Yes there was lots of gore and blood but that does not make a good horror flick if there are no intentions to keep your audience on the edge of your seat, which my friends and I certainly were not.  My only good thing to say of this movie is reading the reviews after I watched it which did remind me of some good moments in the film I had forgotten due to the rest being pretty dull and boring.

The Main jist of "Cabin Fever" is actually pretty clever. Each of the five college kids has some sort of negative issue that consumes them. It does the whole immorality thing from "Halloween" and "Friday the 13th." This suggests that each of them is being punished for their misdeeds. For example, Jordon Ladd's character Karen has drug problems. Her best friend Marcy is very open with her sexuality (tramp), and another guy, Bert is an alcoholic. So since they committed these crimes, Eli Roth (writer/director) is punishing them in the woods. Slowly they are getting killed off by a flesh-eating bacteria that has infested itself in the area. Looking at some of the actually reviews of the film, everyone is optomistic and astounded at "Cabin Fever." But looking at some of the comments other IMDB users had, I realise that they DESPISED the movie with an apparent passion! After watching it and reading everyone's ideas, I think they both have an accurate idea of what it's about- to an extent.Yes- It was unnecessarily gory. Yes- It goes back to our roots of horror in the 80's. Yes- The acting is frightfully corny to a comical extent. AND Yes- This movie perfectly describes how humans react in situations like this, according to instinct. Okay? Still, I give it a 4/10, because the ending bothered me to death. I can't understand what Roth was thinking when he allowed that on screen. His attempts at comic relief feel embarassed in his movie- AND they should be. "Cabin Fever" was still a nice try at reviving old 80's horror flicks. I think some of the critics were looking for something that simply wasn't there- some kind of meaningful symbolism. I also think that the IMDB users are mostly cynical and don't understand what this movie is supposed to be saying. They are so thrown off by some of Eli Roth's bizaare sequences that it has ruined their movie experience. I do suggest you wait until video when watching "Cabin Fever" and don't expect much. Maybe then, what's good about it will come out from the bloody background and you won't be so bitter towards it.

reviews.review_title: Bad, dumber than imaginable, gross, funny
reviews.content: Really stupid film with lots of grossouts, nudity, terrible cheesy music. Somehow it's funny though, sometimes on purpose, like so many bad horror films of the 80s.  I should give it a 3 but I'll go for 5 since some of the humor was a tiny bit effective.

While not in any way a revolutionary movie, this film does just what it is supposed to do, ENTERTAIN!I am not sure why so many of the comments are negative. No, this is not a very frightening movie but thats really not where Cabin Fever focuses. No, The story is not very realistic and the plot has some minor flaws but it has (plenty!) of well executed humor that fully makes up for that. This is by far me and my best friends favorite comedy. The jokes made by characters are natural and sound exactly like comments a bunch of teens out camping in the woods would say. In fact, each of the main characters remind me of someone i know. The locals are also very amusing, viewers will especially enjoy laughing at both the store clerks and police mans ..lets say 'southern" attitude. i Recommend Cabin Fever to anyone looking for a lot of laughs and dark humor but if you are really looking for something scary i would leave this film for another day.

reviews.review_title: the movie sucked....just my personal opinion
reviews.content: Other people I have spoken to about this movie liked it, the only reason I watched it in the first place was parts of the movie was filmed in Davie County which is where I live. Now I did buy the movie, why would I buy a movie that I think sucks, only one reason. My first cousin Donald Lee Hall Jr is in it, even though he has a very small part. I do support my family in whatever they decide to do.When I spoke to my uncle Donald, D.J.'s dad I told him I thought the movie sucked. So it's not like they don't know what I think about it, but like I said it is my on personal opinion.So that is my thoughts on this movie.....Sharon Lea Hall Roberson

reviews.review_title: Awesome, but you must understand first...
reviews.content: I LOVED this movie! I've shied away from watching "horror" movies of late because they are just the usual studio production line crap. Cabin Fever is a welcome change--a nod to the old days of true cult horror. I've read many reviews--most of them calling it "stupid" and "insipid," among other adjectives. Anyone who uses these words to describe this movie simply does not understand the genre. There are many types of horror movies, and to compare this to a "serious" horror film is a travesty, robbing a true future classic of its value.Cabin Fever would have been terrible if it weren't "stupid" and "insipid." It's a tongue-in-cheek homage to the great cult classics. Tongue-in-cheek doesn't work very well if the retarded viewer tries to judge it as a serious horror. If that's your intent, skip this one. It's not for you. But for everyone who loves chips with their cheesy horrors, drop everything and see Cabin Fever. For those of you who worship Sam Raimi and Pre-LOTR Peter Jackson (Don't get me wrong, the trilogy rocks too), this movie is certain to end up in your DVD collection.So to sum up, here's my review: As a serious horror = 1.  As an original, intellectually stimulating script = 1.  As anything to be taken seriously = 1.  As a tongue-in-cheek new horror classic dripping cheese onto my chips = 10!

reviews.review_title: Should Die of Its Own Fictional Disease
reviews.content: This is probably one of the worst films i have ever seen. The events in it are completely random and make little or no sense. The fact that there is a sequel is so sickening i may come down with a case of cabin fever (I'M SO SORRY). I describe it as bug being smooshed to a newspaper because it seems to be different parts of things mixed together. e.g Kevin the pancake loving karate kid is just freakishly weird on its own, then there's the cop who is slightly weird and perverted, then the drug addict, then there's the fact that they attack some random guy who clearly needs help. then all of a sudden the main character is having sex with his friends girlfriend just because she says something stupid about a plane going down. then at the end some good old family racism followed by a rabbit operating on Kevin the karate kid. Its actually pretty despicable that they can use racism as a joke in this film. There is no reason for anyone to enjoy this film unless you love Eli Roth, even that did not make me like this film. Hate is a strong word but seeing as it is the only word i am permitted to use it will have to do. BOYCOTT CABIN FEVER 2!!!!!

Aside from making some great references to other horror movies (Texas Chainsaw Massacre, Evil Dead), It also has a social subtext.  Perhaps I was looking too deep for meaning, but the whole thing reminded me of the AIDS outbreak in the 80's.  The way that the virus eats away at flesh, akin to AIDS eating at one's immune system.  And also, the way that those in town deal with a character's presence with the line "If you're sick, that's your problem.  But if my son is sick, that makes it my problem.  We need to stop the problem!"  This akin to the way many straight people handled the exspantion of AIDS outside the Homosexual comunity.  Granted, I could be looking at the film too in-depth, but even without that subtext, it's one hell of a movie.

This movie was quite entertaining actually. In effect this movie does its job and does so convincingly.the concept of the movie was not really original but the setting in which the movie was placed was: It was very funny to see a freak thing like this happen in a small town in the middle of nowhere, mostly because the behavior of the people living in this town was abnormal, and thats an understatement!. That effect could not have been reached had the movie taken place in a densely populated area. This could of weird off behavior is typical and is seen in a lot of movies which take place in small town deep in the middle of nowhere.The psychological basis of the group dynamics used for the main characters was actually quite flawed seen from a scientific point of view but that shouldn't be a problem with a movie like this. The scare effect was well done and the pace of the movie never really diminished. A shame however that it was such a short movie: They could easily have made this a 100 minute movie. I know a lot of scenes that would have done nicely in this movie!. The overall evaluation of this flick: 7/10.

Hello my name is Nicole Scott. I work for a movie theather. I went to see what Cabin Fever is all about. The movie had no plot. At least one that made no sense. It wasn't scary at all. It was more of a great laugh. So did the rest of the audience. Acting was bad. Complete disappointment. If I had spent the money to see this movie I would have died. Why did they make this movie? I would like to know. Plot had so many holes. Copying sences like from Carrie and the Matrix. If  I  wanted to pay for some laughter I would have gone to Uncle Funny's. Don't see this movie unless you feel the need to laugh or waste time.

I was watching this movie one night. It was funny, especially about that "squirrels are gay" part. This movie was FINE...but somewhat disturbing. Gutting a pig out in front of your T.V screen is just disgusting!!! In the movie, they make the virus/bacteria, necrotizing faciitis look much worse than it really is!!!! Search this disease up, see some pictures, and you'll get the point. Seeing people's flesh falling apart of throwing up blood is disgusting. IF you have the DVD, they have the "Chick" Version, which blocks out the disturbing parts and make this movie more comfortable for people who doesn't like gory things. I'm now a horror fan, but the first time I saw this, I almost threw up, believe me.

This is a comedy film. Which is unfortunate because people call it a horror movie. They are wrong. It is one of the funniest movies you will ever see. If you are looking for a laugh, look no further. If you are looking for horror or suspense, you had better not see this. The film centers around five friends who are celebrating the fact that they have finished finals by going to a remote cabin to party. They apparently drive very far from their college because it is spring in the college town and either fall or winter by the time they get to the cabin. The town, as is required by Hollywood law, is inhabited by simpletons who have lots of guns and make weird faces and seemingly racist remarks at the college kids, one of the young locals even goes so far as to bite people who come near him.Meanwhile, a man who lives in the woods (?) sees a very, very dead dog but decides to poke it and prod it in an attempt to wake it up. The dog, as near as I can tell, died from a reaction to the squirtgun it swallowed which was full of fake red blood which shoots the man in the face and makes him sick with Icky Dead Dog Skin Virus. So, then we see the Hot Brunette Chick's breasts and we learn that the nerdy kid has a crush on the blonde girl who plays the part of the Hot Chick Whose Breasts We Don't Get To See. The Kid With The Green Hat finds a rifle and shoots at a man whom he mistakes for a squirrel. Seriously, I'm not kidding, he thought the man was a squirrel. The man, as it turns out, happens to have Icky Dead Dog Skin Virus and asks for help. Like all people, The Kid With The Green Hat just pretends it didn't happen and goes back to the cabin to party some more. A random stoner kid shows up and he has an old dog with a stupid name. Then he leaves and never comes back, but, the way I see it, he fell in the Fountain Of Youth and subsequently died but his dog got younger and became vicious as a result. For the rest of the movie, when it gets too boring the dog comes back and they shoot at it but somehow miss. Other times, when it is too boring, the Hot Brunette Chick shows her breasts again. After awhile, they get sick from drinking the water - not from being exposed to blood, mind you - but drinking the water. Which I think is weird because the first guy got Icky Dead Dog Skin Virus from the blood. In case the audience starts to ask questions, like, for example, why aren't they getting Icky Dead Dog Skin Virus the way the first guy did? the nerdy kid runs through the woods yelling "it's the water' 'it's the water'.Now, at this point, the movie starts to make no sense and the characters start doing increasingly dumber things.This was a film that cost 1.5 million dollars to make and made over 40 million dollars in it's domestic theatrical run alone. That fact alone says that we, as a country, need electroshock treatment. It also shows that if you have nice breasts in a film, it really doesn't matter what the movie is about. As near as I can tell, about halfway through the screenplay, the writers decided to just make it a comedy. Once they ran out of excuses for the Hot Brunette Chick to show her breasts (four times total, BTW) they opted to go for straight up comedy. Consider the scene in which the Kid Who Bites People screams 'pancakes' and then performs a kind of kung-fu/dance routine... before biting someone. Also, the seemingly racist man is revealed to not be racist in what I imagine the writers considered an M. Night Shamalan-ish "twist." They also, as is required by Hollywood law, added a bumbling simpleton deputy but they had the common sense not to name him 'Dewey'. My feeling is that if the Hot Chick Whose Breasts We Don't Get To See actually showed her breasts that this movie would have made 80 million dollars. In conclusion, the film gets a '2' because it had two breasts in it.

reviews.review_title: A plain horror flick with a slice of lime
reviews.content: OK, so I somewhat agree with the negative critics that this isn't the horror film of the year, but why so many 1/10 ratings?! In my opinion, rarely should we ever rate a movie 1/10 or 10/10... It's too extreme and most often is done out of overreaction.This was a plain horror flick with some very shallow characters, but it's not like this movie deserves to be rewarded with a big bucketful of vomit.Overall, I liked it. Cabin Fever brought to me some of what I expect out of a horror movie. Some thrills, a few cheap scares and good disgust. In fact, the parts where I felt most uncomfortable were BEFORE the actual gore even begins.I've said this in my review of Hostel, which I saw before this feature: Eli Roth is a sick bastard. If you can't deal with sick bastard's movies, don't ever watch any Eli Roth art ever again and please, I reiterate: Don't post a damn review about his work!! I watched this movie with zero (minus one) expectations. Since I don't ever read the "specialist's" opinions nor watch critic shows with mindless, pretentious people who call themselves professionals ranting or praising about what they see at the movies, I had no idea what awaited - except for the fact that I had seen Hostel and thought it would be cool to explore Eli's work.The plot is the definite pro in this movie. Making the main character in your movie be a disease was a pretty cool idea to me. Plus, given this couldn't be an easy task in any given way, especially with such a starve-to-death budget, I have to give more than a crummy rating. 6/10 it is.The cons? Well, they're bundled right in with the pros. The acting is a bit "grade 1 of theater school", but movies such as Friday the Thirteenth and others also had bad actors in them, and still made killings! Personally, it just makes me enjoy the character's deaths all that bit more. Also, it feels like the movie is arranged so that the main characters can't ever get help from normal people and doctors through the entire time. I can understand that they're in the middle of bumhole nowhere, but in these days, you can almost GPS emergency rescue over, provided by NORMAL people from pretty much anywhere.Anyway, the point is this isn't that much of a horror flick, but it does the job, and I completely enjoyed it. The ending had a good intentional laugh in it and it definitely worked for me.If you're out of excellent horror flicks to watch, do take the time to watch this slightly more than decent one.

reviews.review_title: No stars, middle of the woods, no plot = weak movie
reviews.content: SPOILERSHeard Howard Stern's intern is making a movie, so a buddy of mine clued me in for a 90 minute bor-a-thon.  With NO explanation, a flesh eating disease gets mixed into the natural water up in the mountains.  A bunch of no talented actors pretend to be college friends on a trip in the woods and get infected instead.  The box office draw here is Rider Strong.  Don't know who he is?  Of course you don't, but this movie hinges on his star power. He's the "cool" dude from Boy Meets World.  What, Potsie from Happy Days wasn't available?As soon as one of them gets sick from the water, the simple predictable spread of the flesh eating disease goes from person to person until everyone's dead.  The end.  Thank God.Good parts: Everyone dies & the end credits. Bad parts: The rest of the entire movie.Stern is still cool, but this director didn't learn a damn thing about movies which proves you need friends to make movies, not talent.  Anyone see the horrible trailer saying Peter Jackson of L.O.T.R. loving this piece of trash?  The director should stick to getting the King of All Media his coffee and cleaning up High-Pitched Eric's belly button.  For the rest of you, check out the new Robert Rodriguez film, Once Upon a Time in Mexico, instead if you're a person that values their money.

reviews.review_title: One of the best horror movies I've seen in a long time
reviews.content: The whole idea of this film is pretty basic: it's the usual five kids taking a trip to a cabin in the woods, and so on.  However, the approach is a bit different.  While the movie is extremely bloody, and some parts are pretty shocking, the fact is that it's just all really funny.  The characters were believable enough, but they were also presented in an unfavorable light that made them easy to laugh at.  It was as if Eli Roth did not take any of his characters all that seriously, so he had no trouble making fun of them.  The humorous twist made watching this movie a highly enjoyable experience. Also, I found it intriguing how after the initial encounter with the diseased man, the only threat was the possibility of being infected.  I think this helped the film to seem more realistic and more terrifying than if it had gone in the more typical direction of having the kids fight off the same already-dead people for the duration of the movie.The film contains a number of tributes to classic horror films that are sure to please any fan, yet is still original and brilliant in its own right.  It has everything: blood, suspense, humor, a great score, and an ending that is ironic and amusing.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I've ever seen in my life.
reviews.content: Oh man, this movie is seriously the worst movie that I've ever paid to see. While I'm at it, I'll go ahead and venture to say that this is such a horrible film that I wouldn't want to see it again if I was paid to. I feel like I lost approximately 94 minutes of my life watching this movie, this movie literally killed me. If a friend recommends this movie to you, find a new friend.To cut things short, here's the break-down: So, some friends finish their finals at college and decide to go party in the woods, yada-yada, and before you know it people are dying. The end. No, I'm not kidding. Although, I suppose I could add a bit more detail, it's really not worth my time. I guess what really threw me over the edge with this movie is that it had horribly cheesy jokes thrown about randomly, while in the middle of a "serious" scene, if you really want to call it that even.

Not Funny... Not funny at all.I have seen some real crappy horor movies over the years.(In fact I quite enjoy crappy horror movies, just as well because there are heaps of them out there.)But this is just rubbish, a total waste of film stock ... bad acting, plot, directing and anything else that you would expect in a movie.
This load of tripe would make excellent viewing in film schools ... on what NOT to do when making a film.I really hate this film because I wasted valuable time watching it, even though I used fast forward on the really chunderous bits.Avoid it at all costs ... and any thing else by Roth even if he improves 1000% it will still be in the crap category.

About as clever as a train-wreck.  Trite, obvious, and predictable. Roth takes every horror-slasher film considered a classic, puts them in a blender, drinks it up, then vomits it out on film.  This is supposed to be paying homage?  This movie was a tired retread without any of the redeeming qualities of the original films it was attempting to mimic. Please just go rent Evil Dead, Dawn of the Dead, Friday the 13th, Halloween, Scream, Nightmare on Elm Street, Blair Witch Project...ANYTHING ELSE BUT THIS MOVIE!

This movie is great!  I loved it!  My god, after all the lame crap that's come out in the past few years it's so refreshing to finally see a horror film with some teeth. I was actually nervous during much of this movie. Thank god for Eli Roth, the director. God bless him.

This movie blew. For one, how and why didn't people realize this disease was transmitted through water? And come on, to push your friend away like that, its so unreasonable. The acting sucked, the movie sucked and for those who liked it, well you must suck too.This movie is just for the simple minded folk, you little dreamers out there. Now how can this be scary? Anyone, xan you please tell me what to look for. Dreamcatcher blew this movie out of the water, besides great acting its also a book. I would love to here opinion's. Now Texas Chainsaw Massacre, thats a movie. I loved it both old and new. So enjoy, both that is.

after weeks and weeks of being prodded by my kids, we finally rented the DVD.  i think "Cabin Fever" was horrible, it was cheap-ass gory at best. there was not any "horror" other than the impending next gratuitous gore scene.  the end was mottled and unclear, and if you ask me, which none of you did, i think there are more references to back-wood hickishness you would find in "Deliverance". (The people and music at the end). The plot was mottled, there was no direct storyline save for the direct line to death each character would take, this movie just bit!  I am glad I saw it, for no other reason than to warn others away from it.

reviews.review_title: This is the worst movie I've seen in quite some time . . .
reviews.content: yet I continued to watch. I wanted to find out why my cable station rated it at 3 out of a possible 4 stars. I watched all the way to the end and was never satisfied with an answer. The acting was poor, actually atrocious; the plot was incredibly bad; the continuity was unexpectedly poor; the special effects were laughable. I'm not sure why breaking the windows in a truck would result in later being unable to start the vehicle. Why was there so much blood on the outside of the truck when the guy expelled most of the blood on the inside. When did the kids get to him with an accelerant? He couldn't have gone up in flames that way without some help. And why some of the victims contracted the disease a few minutes after exposure, while others were unaffected and the locals seemed not to have any symptoms. What happened to Grim and why did his dog come back alone? Why wasn't the dog infected? These are only a few questions - I could come up with many more, but I'll leave those to other ranters.I wish I could give this "film" a vote of negative 10! Granted, I don't usually watch flicks in the horror genre, but the few I've seen had at least some staying power. I just don't know why I wasted the time to watch this to the end. I guess I kept hoping to find out why the critic gave it such a high rating. I think my suspicions are now verified - there is only one critic working for my cable company!

This movie actually had an okay plot...really. It did. But this movie also soaked up all the blood and gore it could get. Such being the bowling scene where Paul is sitting around the camp fire with his friends, telling the tale of an old crime that went on at a bowling alley he and his dad went to. Now, come on. I was already a little nauseous from seeing so much blood BEFORE this. Was that scene REALLY necessary? I swear, halfway through the movie, I had to pause it because I thought I was going to vomit. So if you are looking for a really graphic sex scene or so much blood that you think it could fill the ocean, I recommend this movie for you. If not, well, I might suggest picking something else for movie night.

reviews.review_title: The STUPIDEST damn movie I have EVER seen!!!!
reviews.content: Oh..... my......GOD! I spent a total of $22 dollars on this movie. $20 dollars for the movie, $1.50 for a gallon of gasoline, and $.50 cents for a lighter to burn the damn thing!!!!! Anybody considering buying this movie.... contact me, I'll send you my copy for free. Be quick though as I'm opening the gas can right now!

The first time i watched this movie, i had bought it cheap from blockbuster and being a fan of hostel, figured that it would be good. But when i watched it, I was kicking myself for watching it. The plot was bad some of the characters were just ridiculous, and I can't remember being scared once. With that said, I decided to watch it a second time and give it another chance. But instead of looking for a scary horror film, I sat down just enjoying the humor and laughing at all the ridiculous amounts of blood and gore. This movie really doesn't aim to be high quality, but it can be a really enjoyable experience. Just don't expect horror.

reviews.review_title: Only watched an hour of this film
reviews.content: This movie was bad from the start. The characters were goofy. You could not take any of them seriously. The entire budget was spent on a cheap nude shot and the movie just went straight downhill from there. Someone owes me an hour of my life back. It was pure torture watching that first hour. I think I might have poked my own eyes out if I had to watch anymore of it. The music was bad too. Did this movie even have a budget? This movie did not scare me or creep me out in the least. If anything it really made me feel sorry for the actors. Not worth the plastic on the DVD it was recorded on nor the postage that Netflix had to spend to send it to me. The best thing that could happen to this film is if it got lost in the mail on the way back to Netflix.

WTF is with this movie?  I saw the trailers for it and thought I had eventually found a modern scary flik that would make me wet my pants, but to no avail! Is this film supposed to be taking the pi$$ or what?  I was shocked and disturbed at the terrible script and the disgraceful story line! Please share your thoughts with me coz i thought it blew!

I thought Cabin Fever would be a brilliant horror,it was! The right amount of gore wasn used here, but i admit there was no scares in this film. But there was a good use of paranoia and reminded me of The Thing. This movie doesn't need a serial killer or monster, it has something new a flesh eating disease. This concept works well. Very well indeed.My rating 10/10

reviews.review_title: Well, the pop and popcorn were good...
reviews.content: Definitely along the lines of the old 80's horror flicks...and I didn't really like many of those, either.  Call me a prude, but I was not at all impressed with the incessant (make that CONSTANT) swearing - most of which was F*** this and F*** that.  Is there a point to that??  I will say that the use of a flesh-eating virus to kill the teens was a new one - kudos to the writers for having at least one point of creativity.  If you haven't seen it, wait for it to come on Starz or HBO - I would NOT suggest paying anything to see it.  And can I get back those 2 hours or so I wasted, and the brain cells I lost, while watching this one?***DON'T READ BELOW IF YOU INTEND TO WATCH THIS MOVIE****Having Jeff killed, though, was too "Night of the Living Dead" (could that BE any less imaginative??) and, if we're going to see that the townsfolk are now drinking the water, can't we at least see the start of their demise as well?  That would have made sitting through that movie a little less painful.

There hasn't been any good horror movies recently.  The only one I can recall is Freddy vs. Jason.  I haven't seen Wrong Turn or House of 1000 Corpses but who cares, I'm pretty sure this movie is better then both.  The best part about this movie is how not holding back it is.  It shows how things would be in real life.  Like the deer and the truck scene.  Or the make up effects of the disease.  It was very real and very scary for being real.  Great horror movie, it reminded me of Evil Dead and other old horror movies.  It's good to see Rider Strong again but I couldn't get the Boy Meets World image away from the movie he was carrying but near the end, I didn't even think of it.  Cerina Vincent from Not Another Teen Movie who played the foriegn exchanged student, once again bares all in this movie, twice.  I found the movie scary with lots of good dark comedy themes to it. I know everyone loves this so I'll end it with... PANCAKES!!!!!!!

Not that this movie can be spoiled. It absolutely sucked. No ifs, ands or ors about it. 100% garbage. I have never before thought about complaining to get my money back - not even for "leviathan", and man that's saying a lot.The script must have been written by a thirteen year old who needs Ritalin. The whole bit with the cop on the bicycle was so bad it was laughable. What the heck did he say? "man, you gotta keep partying, man, like that what its all about" or something that stupid. His acting was so atrocious that I doubt he has a union card, if he does and someone in the business sees this movie they'll yank it. As a matter of fact, I'll bet you'll NEVER see another player in this movie again.This was a classic 'pull the wool over the audiences eyes' with hype, hype and more hype. The website for this crap-fest makes it sound like the audio track was done by some Italian composer with John Williams like credentials. I hate to tell you but I could have done better on my PC.Hey, I especially liked being serenaded by the crappy closing backwards ass country hick make music with a scrub-brush noise they called a song. Thanks also for taking five minutes of my life away as I watched the spring water truck creep away, great film making there.I guess to sum it up, the movie won. I, like a fool, stayed and watched the whole thing. This is a movie that I'd bet a whole stack of money, that your local video store only gets a maximum of two copies - that's if they bother to get it at all.Save yourself the time and a few dollars - go rent leviathan, it sucked big time too but it was ten times better than this trash.You've been warned.

reviews.review_title: A gross-out film for those who enjoy the feeling of germaphobia
reviews.content: The trailers for this movie began rolling in the beginning of the summer, making it highly anticipated among horror fans.  However, as a horror fan myself, I was largely disappointed by its weak plot and overindulgent gore.Cabin Fever focuses on five college students, fresh from finals, ready for a vacation in the woods.  They have rented a cabin and plan on lots of partying, beer drinking, and, let's not forget that staple of the horror genre, lots of sex.  One day, a man who is very obviously ill comes to the cabin asking for help and the students, frightened about catching `it,' scare him away with the use of baseball bats, hairspray, and fire (a combination that guarantees a fun time). Those who catch the flesh-eating virus become vehicles for some truly disgusting makeup tricks and semi-shockers. Roth's film is vaguely reminiscent of Sam Raimi's Evil Dead, which also focuses on doomed friends in a cabin.  However, its style is nowhere near as entertaining.  Roth utilizes a red-stained tint where death may be lurking, and, these days, its impact is just not as effective as it once was. Cabin Fever is definitely a film for those who love a good gross-out.  It will leave you chuckling at times, cringing at most others, and will positively leave you germaphobic for the rest of the evening.

reviews.review_title: Delicious and twisted mixture of horror-themes
reviews.content: This movie was already a classic before it even came out. Well, by rumors anyway. As Eli Roth's debut film it manages to deliver some serious chills and to be hilarious at the same time.Of course the plot is a cliché itself: A bunch of college kids travel to a remote cabin to relax but end up being harvested by a bloodthirsty bacteria. One could conceder this partly a unique idea as we haven't seen too many horror films that actually have a disease as the "villain/menace".This movie is most importantly stylish. The camera work and editing is in fact outstanding and i can see Roth has an eye for this kind of things. The eerie atmosphere is cleverly created with slightly moving camera and fantastic score in the background. Filled with tributes, funny jokes and twisted characters, Cabin Fever is absolutely one of the most precious things in the current horror cinema and if you haven't watched it yet, now is the right time! BTW, love the scene with the accordion. ;)

reviews.review_title: I looked forward to seeing this, what a TOTAL waste!!!!!!
reviews.content: The previews are by far the best thing to come out of this movie, because they made it look 100 times better than it is.  The script, direction, and editing were all terrible.  The acting wasnt much better, but with what the cast had to work with, nobody could have saved this movie. It wasnt scary, but was bloody . .  the flesh eating virus turns skin into a bloody mess and the victims throw up blood everywhere.  The plot was pretty predictable . .5 college kids in a cabin in the woods . .man with virus comes to them for help, they shoot him and set him on fire, he runs off into the woods, eventually the kids start getting sick. The scenes skip from thing to another and so much of this movie doesnt fit together and alot doesnt make sense.  There are attempts at humor, but really those are, in a word, stupid.  My friend and I began our own "Mystery Science Theater" and were openly making fun of how ridiculous it was at the point where a deer ends up being hit by a truck driven by one of the "cabin crew", and almost mauls him to death with its front legs which are protruding through the windshield of the truck and kicking the guy while he just sits there.  After only a few minutes into the movie, it was obvious it wasnt going to be good,  but I kept sitting through this thing because I just knew it had to get better, but believe me, it only gets worse.  They set up the ending paving a way for a sequel . . . .just the thought of that is the only thing scary about this movie!!!!!!!

Cabin Fever was not the best horror film of all time or anything BUT it was one of the best of 2002. It had the same formula of movies like Friday The 13th, kids going out to the cabin for some "fun" and getting knocked off one by one. The only difference here is that instead of a homicidal maniac it's a flesh eating virus. Now I am a Jason fan 100% I like to have a villain to root for, but I was really pleased with the way this film was told. It was scary and funny. Nice combination for a horror film that does not want to take itself too serious. The acting I will admit was not Oscar material but in my opinion it fit the movie. Cabin Fever has its moments that really freak you out a good example of this is when the blonde girl catches the virus and all her friends as well as her boyfriend put her in a shed away from them, they fear they'll catch the virus. But it shows how in extreme circumstances people will turn on the people they love. I gave Cabin Fever a 10 because it did what it was supposed to do. I enjoyed watching the film and even had a few laughs. Excellent Film!!

reviews.review_title: Possibly the worst movie ever made
reviews.content: Please do not let anyone you know go see this horrible movie.  I was shocked to find out the writer/director/producer was not 13 years old.  Thrown together garbage with no tone.  The "actors" were hopefully all first timers working for scale.  Anyone and I mean anyone can equal this production.Bad acting, no plot and a story that has been done many times over.  All with pathetic attempts at bad humor mixed in.Anyone rating this film above a 1 out of 10 MUST be related to this hopefully soon to be unemployed writer/director.

reviews.review_title: Cabin Fever = Waste of time, money, and gas
reviews.content: This movie was just like 28 days later. 28 days later was one of the worst movies i have ever seen. Cabin Fever is definitely on my list of never watch again and warn other people of how crappy it is movies. Please don't waste your time or money on this lame horror/comedy.

reviews.review_title: I felt the need to write this... (sorry, small spoiler- I think)
reviews.content: A bunch of kids go to a cabin in the middle of the woods and subsequently become infected with a flesh eating virus.I felt the need to write this on account of all the negative reviews I have read. I know, everyone is entitled to their own opinion, but some people are fu*kin idiots. Sure this film wasn't "scary", but really- be honest with yourself, is any movie since the 80's scared you that much? I mean, Honestly. You may jump a few times, but you are not scared, and if you watched a horror movie with no jump scares, the scares are on account of "shock", and those are rarely any good. There are few filmmakers that can use this horror technique without immediately going into cliché category. Takashi Miike is one of the few lasting filmmakers that can still disturb me with his visuals, and its a shame he is not more known in the states. The scream/Friday the 13th/Halloween franchises are a joke, they are just keeping those films going because stupid teenagers (not all of them, I will admit... but most of them) keep fu*kin paying to see them. Cabin Fever is one of the few movies that tips it's hat to the old horror movies of the 70's-8o's without completely giving up all hope for a plot. This movie was meant to be scary, but not terrifying. I mean, you are a fu*kin lier if you tell me that you don't find the concept of a skin eating virus the least bit scary. And this whole "the characters act like psychopaths, and no one would actually act like that when put in that situation" argument is bullshit. Of course they would act like that! People are fu*kin selfish, man! You would do the exact same thing when put in that situation. The scary killer is not the flesh eating virus, but the teenagers themselves. In fact, looking back, I don't think one person died from the flesh eating virus in the film. All in all, I think this was a great horror film in comparison to the sh*t we are subject to on a daily basis. Eli Roth IS the future of the horror genre. That is inevitable. Lets just hope he doesn't fu*k it up more, which I highly doubt. Hostel looks excellent. In conclusion, I would just like to say, no- Cabin Fever was not horrifying, nor was it a classic. But it was entertaining and impressive due to the small budget (in comparison to the normal movie nowadays). 8/10

reviews.review_title: The most pathetic excuse for a movie in a long time.
reviews.content: Someone wrote that this movie struggles with the basics.  Basically, this movie struggles to even be a movie.  For the first thirty minutes or so, it convinces the viewer that something big is coming -- that it possesses a great potential.  As those thirty minutes expire, however, the viewer slowly begins to realize that he has been duped.  What he/she has been tricked into waiting for is simply more of a very very bad movie.  The only potential this movie possesses is a very great likelihood that it will be fodder for Mystery Science Theater 3000, should they ever run out of the slightly better movies they now use.

This movie was so stupid I laughed at it most of the time. There was no explanation about what this 'disease' was. It was obvious that the dog was the carrier, but hello -- how the heck did the dog get it?It just plain sucked. Thank God I used a student i.d. to see this because it only cost me 5.50.

A group of horrible teens arrive at a small town the residents of which are even more horrible, and there's also superaids in the water supply. The superaids is incidental, and I'd argue it's even a red herring of a threat. The real threat is obviously how a supernaturally horrible human being everybody is.In the universe of Cabin Fever, no problem ever gets solved since it is always someone else's problem, until it becomes everyone's problem at which point no one has the power to solve it. It is a downward spiral, a representation of entropy that we are all very familiar with in real life and we know from our real life experience that any and every problem the characters in this film face will result in a major catastrophe due to people's unwillingness to deal with it at any of its stages.Although there are a few intolerably disgusting frames that might get to you, it's more comedy than horror. Because you can't really feel too bad for anyone dying in agony when they kind of all deserve it. I'd argue we shouldn't feel bad, neither for the characters nor for their reflections in real life. Just keep selling the superaids lemonade like the good "BUSINESSMEN" we all are and get over it.

I had high hopes for this movie based on the trailers. Now there was some false advertising. It started slow and never got much out of second gear and in the process managed to insult every group represented: stereotypical drunk, self-centered and vicious college students; ignorant, inbred hill folk; neo-nazi AND nerdy cops. I would have given it a 1 except for some brief glimmers of humor. It isn't social commentary, it isn't horror, and it certainly isn't entertainment.

Absolutely brilliant!! Eli Roth, I love you... No horror film scares me anymore, but I was somewhat surprised and totally elated that when Justin (Eli Roth) and Mr Mambo turns up at the camp site - I JUMPED!!
Thank you so much. I loved the storyline of the film, and the characters were just perfect! It's a movie that I will now buy to go next to my other classic horror films. Oh yeah, and I just love The Rotten Fruit, how bloody hilarious!Can't wait to see what will be coming up next.Hopefully this will make up a tenth line of text...Trish Luckie

reviews.review_title: A failure on nearly every level
reviews.content: _Cabin Fever_ is marketed as a horror movie, but it's more than that. It's also part homage (and to some extent, parody), part dark comedy, and part character study. Unfortunately, it not only fails as a whole, it fails on each of these smaller parts as well. Fans of older gorefests will enjoy the Where's Waldo aspect of the film, as the audience is pelted with obvious homage after obvious homage. The writer-director is clearly fascinated with the genre, and the movie suffers from his heavy dependence on and borrowing of the past, because Roth has added nothing innovative of his own.The pacing is completely wrong for a horror movie. The immediate cause of the threat is revealed very early to the audience, and we have to wait in frustration as the bumbling cast manages to botch every effort to save themselves from the unknown. By the time they find out what's going on, it's too late to do anything about it. The characters have wasted their time, and unfortunately, so has the audience.The film dabbles in the surreal, but not the good kind. This is the self-aware "I'm so cool for being weird" surrealism that laces the Faulkner-inspired poetry that litters notebooks in every American high school. My mother is a fish, my mother is a pancake.Except for one or two notable scenes, the gore is rather bland, nothing particularly cringe-worthy or imaginative; you get far more blood, dismemberment, and decapitation in _Freddy vs. Jason_. There are a few cheap scares (an accepted staple of the genre), but any genuine suspense or tension the movie manages to generate is completely lost by the bad pacing, the poorly-timed comedy, the somewhat odd musical choices, the absurd supporting characters stolen from David Lynch's trash can, and the idiotic, unbelievable, and inconsistent main characters who you keep hoping will just die already.On the plus side, the acting is more than passable, and in fact, better than can be found in similar movies. In particular, the shopkeeper's swishy Appalachian twang rang true to this Southerner's ears, though I thought this was set in Texas.If you're looking for a good horror movie on the big screen, skip _Cabin Fever_ and go see _Alien_ when it's re-released. If on the other hand, you applaud weirdness for the sake of weirdness and playing "Name That Homage", you might actually like _Cabin Fever_ for its self-congratulatory randomness.

With the current advent of lousy teen flicks, CABIN FEVER, stands out as a new venture into the horror genre, while going back to the basics of the likes of Evil Dead, TCM, and the terror of Deliverance. CABIN FEVER has done what WRONG TURN desperately tried to do. Become one of the best horror movies since Evil Dead: Dead by Dawn, and scaring the crap out of us. Sex, violence and gore...and a great story with superb acting...what more could a horror fan ask for? A modern classic. Hooray for Horrorwood!

This is a good film. I think that there are so many people who underestimate this film and think that it sucks, but being a pretty big movie buff myself and watching films all the time, this is a good movie. I think that anyone that truly likes movies would have some respect for this film. Any fans of directors out there would also have much respect for this film. Eli Roth is one of the most brilliant directors of all time, in my opinion. He never goes any other way with films. He is a horror buff and always sticks with his horror films, keep up the good work Eli Roth. And for those of you who don't know, there are parts of this movie that were inspired by true events that happened to Eli Roth. There is a great part in this film with a girl shaving her legs and her skin is peeling back. When Eli Roth was young, he had a disease where his skin would literally, if pushed on or scraped, would peel back from his body. Eli Roth is by far one of my favorite directors mainly because he never drifts away from the horror/violence films. Any fans of horror, this is a must see. View this movie with an open mind!

reviews.review_title: I got real Cabin Fever from this!
reviews.content: Eli Roth must have been under the worst drugs he could fish out of the filthy waters in the film when he wrote and directed this. I can't explain the creation of this virus of horror flick any other way.The story of the film has been seen a thousand times (better), it blithely ticks off all the slasher clichés (hillbilly gas station, lonely cabin in the woods, immature teenagers, etc.) without at least trying to give it its own twist.Every single character is extremely unlikable in varying degrees - even to each other - and behaves as idiotically as possible in every conflict situation or challenge. Winston and Bob are perhaps the two most stupidly written characters in film history. As for the dialogue, there are only two options: Eli Roth never socialized or an AI just took over in the middle. I won't even get started on the countless logic holes and plot conveniences.On top of that, there are TV-level camera shots, poor sound design, completely out-of-place music, unmotivated slow-mos, jumbled scene transitions and artificial-looking makeup.Oh well, in the first 45 minutes almost nothing happens and the film is not exciting at any second.According to Wikipedia, Eli Roth allegedly wanted to shoot his own Evil Dead and that's literally what came out.

reviews.review_title: Great movie but not for everyone.
reviews.content: This is the type of film that I have a hard time recomending even though I think it's great.  The reason it is hard for me to recomend this movie is because to me it is deeper than most horror or teen movies and also more disturbing than some.  Some of the stuff is more subtle or original and it might take a second or third viewing to fully appreciate certain parts. Most of the movie had a very cool and original look and feel that I liked very much.  The comedy of the film worked very well for me too.  There were a few moments that were a little too disturbing for my taste but most of the movie was right on. I will be very excited to see what this director does next.  I would like to see him stay with more independent stuff that he would have lot's of control over but I know it does not always work that way. I'm not a huge fan of horror movies but out of all the horror movies I have seen this was towards the top of the list.  I give this movie 8 out of 10

The problem with this movie is that it wasn't scary enough to be a horror film and wasn't funny enough to be a comedy.Director Eli Roth consistently sets up workable horror premises and at times creates a tense and unnerving atmosphere, but then he'll pop a joke in, either surreal or aimed at debunking the conventions of the horror genre. Time after time I was left wondering whether I'd seen a promising horror scene ruined by casual directing or whether I'd seen a very poor attempt at a postmodern gag.However, if I'd have known that this was a camp, kitsch cult movie I would have liked it an awful lot more than I did, because I was constantly waiting to be scared. The only horror element this movie really delivers are the endless shots of dismembered bodies, blood, gore, decaying flesh, people vomiting blood all over each other etc. But oddly these scenes aren't really all that kitsch - I found them as funny as the endless succession of murders in City Of God or the relentless intensity of the first half hour of Saving Private Ryan. i.e. not funny at all, just mildly disturbing and unpleasant.
There's plenty of gore, but every bit of psychological tension is scuppered by the director - either deliberately or by accident. After sitting through the movie, talking to plenty of people about it and reading all the comments on iMDb, I'm still not sure which he was trying to achieve.

*spoilers*Having seen a big load of horror movies (including a lot of classics) I think I can call myself a horror-buff without exaggerating. That being said, I honestly don't see why the fk people keep slandering this movie? The story isn't bad, it's ok and frankly imo it's a lot better than that of most "horror" movies that came out the last 5 years, possibly the last decade even (ofcourse the definition of horror is relative, I suppose most movies that are 'scary' are branded horror these days). On top of that I think the way it ends is 'realistic' and good too, nobody gets miraculously cured or anything, the story ends bad and mostly gruesome for all the protagonists. The acting? If you ask me it wasn't bad at all; Rider Strong, Cerina Vincent, ... all did their job pretty well I think (and Cerina is damn hot :D). And finally the gore. The term GORE really is in place here. It's very realistic, very, very well done. Made me turn my head away a few times (like when Cerina Vincent is taking a bath and scratches away a part of her leg while shaving and her back is so gross, and the next scene where the dog attacks her or the scene with Jordan Ladd's face being eaten away partially with the bare teeth).To summarize I think Eli Roth did a very good job with this movie. It's scary, it's gross, it's horror.
